intro: Microlicia neogracilis, commonly known as the slender microlicia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its delicate, slender stems and small, hairy leaves. Its flowers are typically pink or purple, and they bloom in clusters. Microlicia neogracilis is often found in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and wetlands.
